flags.title: Krylon Sponsored Project
flags.text: This project is sponsored by Krylon.

guide.introduction:
Completely makeover a lackluster guitar with a gleaming glitter finish. Don't be intimidated to dismantle the pieces of a beater guitar and customize your instrument with a coat of paint.

Add vivid, colorful shine with a gorgeous spray paint from Krylon called Glitter Blast. It is fully saturated sparkle. The paint dries into a pure glitter coating within 20 minutes.

In an afternoon crafting you can bring a garage sale instrument from obscurity to the spotlight.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Completely makeover a lackluster guitar with a gleaming glitter finish. Don't be intimidated to dismantle the pieces of a beater guitar and customize your instrument with a coat of paint.

Add vivid, colorful shine with a gorgeous spray paint from Krylon called Glitter Blast. It is fully saturated sparkle. The paint dries into a pure glitter coating within 20 minutes.

In an afternoon crafting you can bring a garage sale instrument from obscurity to the spotlight.

Relevant parts
  • Krylon Glitter Blast Glitter Spray
  • Krylon Glitter Blast Clear Sealer
  • Painter's tape
  • Sandpaper
  • Dropcloth
Tools
  • Needle Nose Pliers
  • Phillips head screwdriver
  • Respirator

lines.text: Plan for a dramatic makeover. Choose a shade of Glitter Blast that will work with the guitar's base color. I chose Twilight Sky, a mix of brilliant blue and purple. I love how it turned out.
lines.text_raw: Plan for a dramatic makeover. Choose a shade of Glitter Blast that will work with the guitar's base color. I chose Twilight Sky, a mix of brilliant blue and purple. I love how it turned out.

lines.text: Throw on clothes that you can paint in, and gather up all your supplies. Protect your workspace with plastic and paper dropcloth.
lines.text_raw: Throw on clothes that you can paint in, and gather up all your supplies. Protect your workspace with plastic and paper dropcloth.

lines.text: Unscrew everything on the front of the guitar. Keep track of every screw.
lines.text_raw: Unscrew everything on the front of the guitar. Keep track of every screw.

lines.text: If you aren't familiar with the inner workings of an electric guitar, stop here and take a photograph. A quick picture on your cellphone is the perfect map for putting everything back together.
lines.text_raw: If you aren't familiar with the inner workings of an electric guitar, stop here and take a photograph. A quick picture on your cellphone is the perfect map for putting everything back together.

lines.text: If the guitar has a floating bridge, use the pliers to remove it.
lines.text_raw: If the guitar has a floating bridge, use the pliers to remove it.

lines.text: Cover every component with painter's tape.
lines.text_raw: Cover every component with painter's tape.

lines.text: Use plastic to protect the neck and head.
lines.text_raw: Use plastic to protect the neck and head.

lines.text: Wearing your respirator, carefully sand the body of the guitar. Use ultra-fine sandpaper to evenly scuff the painted surface.
lines.text_raw: Wearing your respirator, carefully sand the body of the guitar. Use ultra-fine sandpaper to evenly scuff the painted surface.

lines.text: Shake the can of Krylon Glitter Blast to mix the glitter for 2 minutes. To achieve the airbrushed look, hold the can 2 feet away from the guitar and work in big swooping motions. Apply the glitter in one continuous coat, painting in circles all around the guitar until it is fully covered in glitter.
lines.text_raw: Shake the can of Krylon Glitter Blast to mix the glitter for 2 minutes. To achieve the airbrushed look, hold the can 2 feet away from the guitar and work in big swooping motions. Apply the glitter in one continuous coat, painting in circles all around the guitar until it is fully covered in glitter.

lines.text: Be sure to wear the respirator.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to wear the respirator.

lines.text: Hang plastic sheeting to protect your workspace from overspray and make cleaning up fast.
lines.text_raw: Hang plastic sheeting to protect your workspace from overspray and make cleaning up fast.

lines.text: Let the glitter dry for about 20 minutes, then finish it with the Krylon Glitter Blast Clear Coat. It helps keep the glitter fixed in place.
lines.text_raw: Let the glitter dry for about 20 minutes, then finish it with the Krylon Glitter Blast Clear Coat. It helps keep the glitter fixed in place.

lines.text: The guitar will be dry to the touch in another 20 minutes. It's best to leave it hanging for 24 hours to fully dry and cure.
lines.text_raw: The guitar will be dry to the touch in another 20 minutes. It's best to leave it hanging for 24 hours to fully dry and cure.

lines.text: Piece by piece, replace the parts of the instrument, until you've restrung your shining new guitar.
lines.text_raw: Piece by piece, replace the parts of the instrument, until you've restrung your shining new guitar.

guide.summary: Transform an electric guitar with Krylon Glitter Blast spray paint.
guide.time_required: 2 hours to prep and paint, 20 minutes to handle, cured in 1 day
